de.a46.memory
Class Starter

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--java.awt.Component
        |
        +--java.awt.Container
              |
              +--java.awt.Panel
                    |
                    +--java.applet.Applet
                          |
                          +--de.a46.memory.Starter
All Implemented Interfaces:
javax.accessibility.Accessible, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, LoadListener, java.awt.MenuContainer, MultimediaProvider, ParameterProvider, java.io.Serializable, UserActionListener
public class Starter
extends java.applet.Applet
implements UserActionListener, LoadListener, ParameterProvider, MultimediaProvider

Class Starter is the main class of this memory. It is called by the browser to run the program. It initializes the three second level objects, as there are a Game, a Loader and a MainPanel. For this reason it must implement several interfaces:

- interface UserActionListener is implemented to perform reactions to events coming in from the gui layer (mainPanel),
- interface LoadListener enables this Starter to show the load status in its status bar,
- interface ParameterProvider bundles a few parameters, the starter is getting via param-tags from its html start site, and that are essentially for class loader to get to external resources.
- interface MultiMediaProvider capsulates the Starters possibilities to create images and AudioClips from filenames (inherited from class Applet). This is also needed for coordinated work with a Loader instance.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Till Zoppke
See Also:

Constructor Detail

Starter

public Starter()
Method Detail

init

public void init()
Called by the browser. initializes this instance and the loader. The welcomeImage is loaded and painted. Then basicImages are loaded and the mainPanel is initialized. After that an instance of class game is constructed and currentData is loaded. Finally the game is started.
Overrides:
init in class java.applet.Applet

newgameAction

public void newgameAction()
Restarts the game. Cards will be refreshed, current card images and current background images reloaded. Then the initCurrentData methods of mainPanel and Game are called.
Specified by:
newgameAction in interface UserActionListener

exitAction

public void exitAction()
Quits the applet by calling a autoclosing html page. The path of this site is specified by parameter AUTOCLOSE_FILE in the html site, in which the applet is embedded. If you run this applet in appletviewer nothing will happen.
Specified by:
exitAction in interface UserActionListener

cardClicked

public void cardClicked(int cardID)
This method is called, when the user clicks one of the hiddencards in the field. The call is passed to Game.cardMove(int)
Specified by:
cardClicked in interface UserActionListener
Parameters:
cardID - an int representing the clicked card's id, that is its index in the hiddencards array of class FieldPanel.

bigImageClicked

public void bigImageClicked()
Called when there was a user action to a big image on the left. At first Game.imageMove() is evoked. Then it is checked, whether the field is empty now. In this case, after a few seconds pause, a new game is started. During the pause there is a small animation in the status bar.
Specified by:
bigImageClicked in interface UserActionListener

getBackgroundBase

public java.lang.String getBackgroundBase()
Returns a String containing the relative path to the directory, where the background images are located. This info is taken from parameter BACKGROUND_BASE of the embedding html file.
Specified by:
getBackgroundBase in interface ParameterProvider

getDataBase

public java.lang.String getDataBase()
Returns a String containing the relative path to the directory, where the basic images are located. This info is taken from parameter DATA_BASE of the embedding html file.
Specified by:
getDataBase in interface ParameterProvider

imageLoaded

public void imageLoaded(LoadEvent e)
Notifies the user about loading events by writing text to the status bar. This method is called by class Loader when a waitForXXX is performed. Info what to write is taken from the LoadEvent argument and by calling Loader.getLoadingStatus(). The text to write in the status bar is hardcoded.
Specified by:
imageLoaded in interface LoadListener
Parameters:
e - a LoadEvent specifying what happened.

paint

public void paint(java.awt.Graphics g)
Paints the welcome image, if no Mainpanel is constructed yet. This takes place during loading. Otherwise nothing is done.
Overrides:
paint in class java.awt.Container

stop

public void stop()
Called by the browser to stop this applet. The call is passed to Game.stop(), because maybe a Threadis running there.
Overrides:
stop in class java.applet.Applet
